item.text: Later David defeated the Philistines and subdued them. He took Gath and its surrounding towns away from the Philistines.
He defeated the Moabites; the Moabites became David’s subjects and brought tribute.
David defeated King Hadadezer of Zobah as far as Hamath, when he went to extend his authority to the Euphrates River.

<st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="03920" class="">seized</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> him <st data-num="0505" class="">1,000</st> <st data-num="07393" class="">chariots</st>, <st data-num="07651 0505">7,000</st> <st data-num="06571" class="">charioteers</st>,<n id="1" /> and <st data-num="06242 0505">20,000</st> <st data-num="0376 07273">infantrymen</st>. <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="06131" class="">cut the hamstrings of</st> <st data-num="03605 07393">all</st> <st data-num="03498" class="">but</st> <st data-num="03967" class="">100</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">of</st> Hadadezer’s<n id="2" /> <st data-num="07393" class="">chariot horses</st>.<n id="3" />

The <st data-num="0758" class="">Arameans</st> of <st data-num="01834" class="">Damascus</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">came</st> to <st data-num="05826" class="">help</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="01909" class="">Hadadezer</st> of <st data-num="06678" class="">Zobah</st>, but <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="05221" class="">killed</st> <st data-num="06242 08147 0505">22,000</st> of the <st data-num="0758 0376">Arameans</st>.
David placed garrisons in the territory of the Arameans of Damascus; the Arameans became David’s subjects and brought tribute. The Lord protected David wherever he campaigned.

<st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="03947" class="">took</st> the <st data-num="02091" class="">golden</st> <st data-num="07982" class="">shields</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">which</st> <st data-num="01909" class="">Hadadezer’s</st> <st data-num="05650" class="">servants</st> had <st data-num="01961 05921">carried</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="0935" class="">brought</st> them to <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st>.<n id="2" />
From Tibhath and Kun, Hadadezer’s cities, David took a great deal of bronze. (Solomon used it to make the big bronze basin called “The Sea,” the pillars, and other bronze items.)
When King Tou of Hamath heard that David had defeated the entire army of King Hadadezer of Zobah,

he <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> his <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> <st data-num="01913" class="">Hadoram</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> to <st data-num="07592" class="">extend</st> his <st data-num="07965" class="">best wishes</st><n id="2" /> and to <st data-num="01288" class="">pronounce a blessing on</st> him <st data-num="05921 0834">for</st> his <st data-num="03898 05221">victory</st> over <st data-num="01909" class="">Hadadezer</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> <st data-num="08583" class="">Tou</st> had <st data-num="01961" class="">been</st> <st data-num="0376 04421">at war</st> with <st data-num="01909" class="">Hadadezer</st>.<n id="3" /> He also sent <st data-num="03605" class="">various</st> <st data-num="03627" class="">items</st> made of <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st>, <st data-num="03701" class="">silver</st>, and <st data-num="05178" class="">bronze</st>.<n id="4" />
King David dedicated these things to the Lord, along with the silver and gold which he had carried off from all the nations, including Edom, Moab, the Ammonites, the Philistines, and Amalek.
Abishai son of Zeruiah killed 18,000 Edomites in the Valley of Salt.
He placed garrisons in Edom, and all the Edomites became David’s subjects. The Lord protected David wherever he campaigned.
David reigned over all Israel; he guaranteed justice for all his people.

<st data-num="03097" class="">Joab</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="06870" class="">Zeruiah</st> was <st data-num="05921" class="">commanding general of</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="06635" class="">army</st>; <st data-num="03092" class="">Jehoshaphat</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="0286" class="">Ahilud</st> was <st data-num="02142" class="">secretary</st>;

<st data-num="06659" class="">Zadok</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="0285" class="">Ahitub</st> and <st data-num="040" class="">Abimelech</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="054" class="">Abiathar</st> were <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st>; <st data-num="07798" class="">Shavsha</st><n id="1" /> was <st data-num="05608" class="">scribe</st>;
Benaiah son of Jehoiada supervised the Kerethites and Pelethites; and David’s sons were the king’s leading officials.
